name: Frontend Development
description: Client-side web technologies focused on user interfaces and user experience. This category covers JavaScript frameworks, libraries, and tools used to build interactive, responsive web applications that run in the browser.

name: Backend Development
description: Server-side technologies and frameworks that handle business logic, data processing, and API development. These technologies power the behind-the-scenes functionality that enables web applications to process requests and manage data.

name: Mobile Development
description: Native and cross-platform mobile application development frameworks and tools. This category includes technologies for building iOS and Android apps, from native solutions to hybrid frameworks that work across multiple platforms.

name: Database Systems
description: Data storage and management solutions including relational and NoSQL databases. These technologies handle data persistence, querying, and management for applications of all scales, from simple web apps to enterprise systems.

name: DevOps & Cloud
description: Infrastructure, deployment, and cloud services that enable scalable application development and operations. This category covers containerization, CI/CD pipelines, cloud platforms, and tools for automating software delivery and infrastructure management.

name: AI/ML & Data Science
description: Machine learning frameworks, data analysis tools, and artificial intelligence platforms. These technologies enable developers to build intelligent applications, analyze large datasets, and implement machine learning models for various use cases.

name: Testing Frameworks
description: Quality assurance and testing tools that ensure application reliability and performance. This category includes unit testing, integration testing, end-to-end testing, and performance testing frameworks used throughout the development lifecycle.

name: CSS Frameworks
description: Styling and UI component libraries that accelerate frontend development and ensure consistent design. These frameworks provide pre-built components, utility classes, and design systems for creating modern, responsive user interfaces.
